info.description: The Stripe API allows you to process payments, manage customers and subscriptions, and handle transactions securely.
info.title: Stripe API
info.summary: Process payments, manage customers and subscriptions, and handle transactions securely.

paths.description: Retrieve the details of your Stripe account, including information such as account balance, settings, and other relevant data. This endpoint is useful for accessing your account's current status and configuration.

Create an AccountLink object to generate a single-use URL for onboarding users through the Stripe Connect process. This URL directs users to complete their account setup, making it essential for platforms managing user accounts.

Create an AccountSession object to obtain a single-use token for client-side API access. This token allows platforms to securely interact with Stripe's API from the front-end, facilitating operations like payment processing.

Retrieve a list of accounts connected to your platform using Stripe Connect. This endpoint is useful for platforms to manage and view all associated accounts. If you are not a platform, the returned list will be empty.

Create a new Stripe account for a user on your platform using Stripe Connect. This process involves registering your platform and optionally prefilling user information to streamline the onboarding process.
Delete a managed account on your platform using Stripe Connect. Test-mode accounts can be deleted anytime, while live-mode accounts have specific conditions based on account type and balance status.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific account, including its settings, balance, and other relevant data. This is useful for managing and reviewing account details on your platform.

Update a connected account's details by modifying the specified parameters. This is applicable for both Custom and Standard accounts, with certain restrictions based on the account type and onboarding status.
Add a new external bank account to a specified Stripe account. This allows the account to receive payouts or make payments using the added bank account.
paths.summary: Add bank account to Stripe account

paths.description: Remove a specific external bank account from a Stripe account. This action is useful for managing the bank accounts associated with a Stripe account.
paths.summary: Remove bank account from Stripe account

paths.description: Retrieve details of a specific external bank account linked to a Stripe account. This includes information such as account holder name and type.
Update the metadata, account holder name, or type of a bank account associated with a connected account. You can also set it as the default for its currency. Only applicable for Custom accounts.
Retrieve a list of capabilities associated with a Stripe account. Capabilities indicate the features available to the account, such as accepting payments or issuing refunds.
Retrieve details about a specific capability of a Stripe account. Capabilities define what actions the account can perform, such as processing payments.
Update an existing capability for a Stripe account. You can request or remove a capability by adjusting its 'requested' parameter, which determines the account's available features.
Retrieve a list of external accounts, such as bank accounts or debit cards, associated with a Stripe account. This is useful for managing the financial accounts linked to a Stripe account.
Add a new external account, such as a bank account or debit card, to a Stripe account. This enables the account to perform transactions using the added financial account.
Remove a specified external account, such as a bank account or debit card, from a Stripe account. This is useful for managing and updating the financial accounts linked to a Stripe account.
Retrieve details of a specified external account, such as a bank account or debit card, linked to a Stripe account. This includes information like account holder name and type.
Update the metadata, account holder name, or type of an external account associated with a connected account. You can also set it as the default for its currency. Only applicable for Custom accounts.
Create a login link for a connected account to access the Express Dashboard. This is only available for accounts using the Express Dashboard and connected to your platform.
Retrieve a list of people associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. The list is sorted by creation date, showing the most recently added people first.
Create a new person associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. This is useful for adding individuals who have roles or responsibilities within the account.
Delete a person's relationship to a Stripe account's legal entity. Certain restrictions apply, such as not being able to delete the account opener or the only verified executive.
Retrieve details of an existing person associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. This includes information about their role and relationship to the account.
Update details of an existing person associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. This is useful for modifying roles or personal information.
Retrieve a list of people associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. The list is sorted by creation date, showing the most recently added people first.
Create a new person associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. This is useful for adding individuals who have roles or responsibilities within the account.
Delete a person's relationship to a Stripe account's legal entity. Certain restrictions apply, such as not being able to delete the account opener or the only verified executive.
Retrieve details of an existing person associated with a Stripe account's legal entity. This includes information about their role and relationship to the account.

This endpoint allows you to update the details of an existing person associated with a specific account. It is useful for modifying personal information such as name, address, or other attributes related to the person.

This endpoint is used to reject accounts that have been flagged as suspicious within the Stripe Connect platform. It is applicable to accounts where your platform is responsible for negative balances, such as Custom and Express accounts. Test-mode accounts can be rejected anytime, while live-mode accounts require a zero balance before rejection.
Retrieve a list of domains that have been registered for use with Apple Pay. This is useful for managing and verifying the domains that are authorized to process Apple Pay transactions.
Register a new domain for use with Apple Pay. This allows the specified domain to be authorized for processing Apple Pay transactions, enabling seamless payments on your website.
Remove a registered domain from Apple Pay authorization. This action will prevent the domain from processing Apple Pay transactions, effectively disabling Apple Pay on that domain.
Retrieve details about a specific domain registered for Apple Pay. This includes information about the domain's registration status and its eligibility to process Apple Pay transactions.

Retrieve a list of application fees that have been collected by your account. The fees are returned in descending order, starting with the most recent. This is useful for tracking and managing fees associated with your applications.
Retrieve details about a specific refund associated with an application fee.
Update the metadata of a specific application fee refund. This endpoint allows you to modify the metadata associated with a refund, while other parameters remain unchanged.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific application fee collected by your account. This includes the fee's amount, currency, and associated transactions.
Initiate a refund for a specific application fee. This endpoint allows you to refund the entire fee or a portion of it, returning the funds to the original Stripe account.
Retrieve a list of refunds associated with a specific application fee.
Create a refund for an application fee that has been collected.
Retrieve a list of all secrets stored within a specified scope. This is useful for managing and auditing the secrets used in your applications.
Create or update a secret in the secret store. This endpoint allows you to manage sensitive information securely by setting or replacing secrets within a specified scope.
Remove a secret from the secret store by specifying its name and scope. This action deletes the secret, ensuring it is no longer accessible.
Locate a specific secret within the secret store by providing its name and scope. This endpoint helps you find and verify the existence of a secret.
Retrieve the current balance of your Stripe account. This includes available and pending funds, providing a comprehensive view of your account's financial status.
Retrieve a list of transactions that have affected your Stripe account balance. This includes charges, transfers, and other financial activities, sorted by the most recent transactions first.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific balance transaction using its unique ID. This includes the transaction's amount, type, and associated metadata.

Retrieve a list of transactions that have contributed to your Stripe account balance. This includes various financial activities, sorted by the most recent first, and is useful for financial tracking and analysis.
Retrieve details of a specific balance transaction by its ID. This provides insights into the transaction's nature, amount, and related data.
Retrieve a list of billing alerts, both active and inactive. This helps in monitoring and managing billing-related notifications and alerts.
Create a new billing alert to monitor specific billing conditions or thresholds. This is useful for proactive financial management and oversight.
Retrieve details of a specific billing alert using its ID. This includes information about the alert's conditions, status, and history.
Reactivate a previously deactivated billing alert, allowing it to trigger notifications again. This is useful for re-enabling monitoring after temporary deactivation.
Archive a billing alert, removing it from active monitoring and list views. This action is irreversible and is used to permanently disable an alert.
Deactivate a billing alert to prevent it from triggering further notifications. This is useful for temporarily disabling alerts without permanently removing them.
Retrieve a summary of the credit balance for a specific customer. This provides an overview of available credits and their application to future invoices.
Retrieve a list of transactions affecting the credit balance of a customer. This includes credits applied, adjustments, and other related activities.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific credit balance transaction using its unique ID. This endpoint helps you track and manage credit balance changes for a customer.
Retrieve a comprehensive list of credit grants. Credit grants are allocations of credit to a customer's account, which can be used to offset future charges.
Create a new credit grant for a customer. This allows you to allocate a specific amount of credit to a customer's account, which can be used to reduce future billing amounts.
Retrieve details of a specific credit grant using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the credit amount and its usage.
Update an existing credit grant by modifying its attributes. This can include changing the credit amount or adjusting its expiration.
Expire a specific credit grant, making it no longer available for use. This is useful for managing unused or outdated credits.
Void a specific credit grant, effectively canceling it and preventing any further use. This is useful for correcting errors or managing credits that should not be applied.
Create an adjustment for a billing meter event. This allows you to modify the recorded usage of a metered billing item, which can affect the customer's billing.
Create a new billing meter event to record usage for a metered billing item. This is essential for tracking customer usage and calculating charges based on consumption.
Retrieve a list of all billing meters. Billing meters are used to track usage for metered billing items, allowing you to charge customers based on their consumption.
Create a new billing meter to track usage for a metered billing item. This is necessary for implementing usage-based billing for customers.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific billing meter using its unique ID. This helps in managing and reviewing the usage tracking for a particular metered item.
Update the details of an existing billing meter. This can include changes to the meter's configuration or usage tracking parameters.
Deactivate a specific billing meter, stopping any further usage tracking. This is useful for meters that are no longer needed or should not be used.
Retrieve a list of event summaries for a specific billing meter. These summaries provide an overview of the usage events recorded for the meter.
Reactivate a previously deactivated billing meter, allowing it to resume usage tracking. This is useful for meters that need to be used again after being paused.
Retrieve a list of configurations for the customer portal. These configurations define how the portal behaves and what features are available to customers.
Create a new configuration for the customer portal, specifying its functionality and behavior. This allows customization of the portal experience for customers.
Retrieve details of a specific customer portal configuration using its unique identifier. This helps in understanding the setup and features available in the portal.
Update an existing customer portal configuration to change its functionality or behavior. This allows for adjustments to the customer experience in the portal.
Create a new session for the customer portal, allowing a customer to access their billing information and manage their account settings.
Retrieve a list of all charges that have been created, sorted by the most recent. This helps in reviewing past transactions and managing financial records.
This method is deprecated. Use the Payment Intents API to initiate new payments. Confirming a PaymentIntent creates the Charge object for payment requests.
Search for previously created charges using Stripe's Search Query Language. Note that search results may not reflect recent changes immediately and are not available in India.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific charge using its unique ID. This includes all details from when the charge was created or refunded.
Update the specified charge by changing the values of the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged.
Capture the payment of an existing, uncaptured charge. Uncaptured payments expire after a set period and are marked as refunded if not captured in time.
Retrieve details of a dispute associated with a specific charge. This helps in managing and resolving disputes effectively.
Update the details of a dispute for a specific charge. This can include providing additional information or evidence to support the dispute resolution.
Close an open dispute for a specific charge. This action finalizes the dispute process and prevents further changes.

This endpoint allows you to refund a previously created charge that has not yet been refunded. The refund is processed back to the original credit or debit card used for the charge. You can choose to refund the entire charge or just a portion of it, and you can continue to refund parts of the charge until the full amount is refunded. Once a charge is fully refunded, it cannot be refunded again. Attempting to refund more than the remaining amount or refunding an already refunded charge will result in an error.

Retrieve a list of refunds associated with a specific charge. By default, the 10 most recent refunds are available on the charge object. If you need to access more than these, you can use this endpoint with pagination parameters to view additional refunds.

Use this endpoint to create a refund for a charge that has been previously made but not yet refunded. The refund will be sent back to the original payment method. You can refund the full amount or a partial amount, and you can continue to issue partial refunds until the total charge is refunded. Once a charge is fully refunded, it cannot be refunded again. Attempting to refund more than the remaining balance or an already refunded charge will result in an error.
paths.summary: Initiate a refund for a charge

paths.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific refund using its unique identifier. This endpoint provides all the details related to the refund, such as the amount refunded, the status, and any associated metadata.
Update the details of a specific refund. This can include modifying metadata or other editable fields associated with the refund. Note that not all fields may be editable.
Retrieve a list of all Checkout Sessions. Checkout Sessions are used to manage the payment process for a customer, including the items being purchased and the payment method used.
Create a new Checkout Session object. This session is used to handle the payment process for a customer, including the items being purchased and the payment method.
Retrieve the details of a specific Checkout Session using its unique identifier. This includes information about the items being purchased, the payment status, and other session-specific data.
Update the details of an existing Checkout Session. This can include modifying metadata or other editable fields associated with the session.
Expire an active Checkout Session. Once expired, the session cannot be completed by the customer, and any attempt to access it will show an expiration message.

Retrieve the line items associated with a specific Checkout Session. Line items represent the products or services being purchased in the session. This endpoint provides a paginated list of all line items.

Retrieve a list of all Climate order objects. The orders are sorted by creation date, with the most recent orders appearing first. Climate orders are related to products that contribute to environmental sustainability.

Create a new Climate order for a specified Climate product. The order is processed immediately, and the payment is deducted from your Stripe balance. Climate orders support products that contribute to environmental sustainability.
Retrieve the details of a specific Climate order using its unique ID. This includes information about the order's status, the associated Climate product, and any relevant metadata.
Update the specified Climate order by modifying the values of the parameters passed. This can include changes to metadata or other editable fields.

Cancel a Climate order within 24 hours of creation. When canceled by the user, the reservation amount is refunded, excluding fees. If canceled by Frontier due to supplier issues, a full refund is provided with 90 days notice.
Retrieve a list of all available Climate product objects. These products are associated with environmental sustainability initiatives.
Retrieve the details of a specific Climate product using its unique ID. This includes information about the product's features, pricing, and any associated metadata.
Retrieve a list of all available Climate supplier objects. These suppliers are involved in providing products or services that support environmental sustainability.
Retrieve the details of a specific Climate supplier using its unique ID. This includes information about the supplier's offerings and their role in environmental sustainability.
Retrieve an existing ConfirmationToken object using its unique identifier. This token is used to confirm certain actions or transactions within the Stripe system.
Retrieve a list of all available Country Spec objects. These objects provide information about the requirements and specifications for operating in different countries.
Retrieve the Country Spec for a specific country using its country code. This includes details about the requirements and specifications for operating in that country.
Retrieve a list of all your coupons. Coupons can be used to apply discounts to invoices or subscriptions.
Create a new coupon via the API or the Stripe dashboard. Coupons can offer a percentage or fixed amount discount on invoices. They are useful for promotions or customer retention.
Delete a coupon using the API or the Stripe dashboard. Deleting a coupon prevents new customers from using it, but does not affect existing customers who have already applied it.
Retrieve the details of a specific coupon using its unique ID. This includes information about the discount type, amount, and any restrictions.
Update the metadata of an existing coupon. Note that other coupon details such as currency, duration, and discount amount are not editable.
Retrieve a list of all credit notes. Credit notes are used to adjust the amount of a finalized invoice, either by refunding or crediting the customer's balance.

Issue a credit note to adjust the amount of a finalized invoice. For open invoices, it reduces the amount due. For paid invoices, it can result in a refund, a customer balance credit, or an outside of Stripe credit. Multiple credit notes can be issued for a single invoice.
Retrieve a preview of a credit note to see its details before actually creating it. This allows you to review the credit note's impact on an invoice or customer account without making any changes.

Access the complete list of line items for a credit note preview. This endpoint provides a paginated list of all items included in the credit note preview, allowing you to see detailed information about each item.

Retrieve the full list of line items associated with a specific credit note. This endpoint provides detailed information about each item included in the credit note, allowing for a comprehensive view of its contents.
Retrieve a specific credit note using its unique identifier. This endpoint provides all the details of the credit note, including its status, amount, and associated invoice.
Update an existing credit note with new information. This allows you to modify details such as the amount or description of the credit note.
Mark a credit note as void, effectively canceling it. This action is irreversible and should be used when a credit note is no longer valid or needed.
Create a Customer Session object that generates a single-use client secret. This secret can be used on the front-end to securely access certain customer resources via the API.
Retrieve a list of all customers associated with your account. The customers are sorted by their creation date, with the most recent appearing first.
Create a new customer object in your Stripe account. This includes details such as the customer's name, email, and payment information.

Search for customers you have previously created using Stripe's Search Query Language. Note that search results may not reflect recent changes immediately, and this feature is unavailable to merchants in India.
Permanently delete a customer from your Stripe account. This action cannot be undone and will also cancel any active subscriptions associated with the customer.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific customer using their unique identifier. This includes the customer's profile, payment methods, and subscription status.
Update the details of an existing customer. You can modify information such as the customer's payment source or personal details. Unspecified parameters will remain unchanged.
Retrieve a list of transactions that have affected a customer's balance. This includes all credits and debits applied to the customer's account.
Create a new transaction that updates a customer's credit balance. This transaction is immutable and will adjust the customer's balance accordingly.
Retrieve details of a specific balance transaction that has affected a customer's account. This includes information about the transaction amount and type.
Update the description and metadata of a specific balance transaction. Most fields of a balance transaction are immutable, but these can be modified.
Retrieve a list of bank accounts associated with a customer. By default, the 10 most recent bank accounts are shown, but you can paginate through additional accounts if needed.

Add a new bank account to a customer. If the customer does not have a default bank account, the new account will become the default. Otherwise, the default will remain unchanged unless updated separately.
Remove a specific bank account from a customer's account. This action deletes the bank account as a payment source for the customer.
Retrieve details about a specific bank account associated with a customer. This includes information such as the bank name, account type, and last four digits of the account number.
Update details of a specific bank account for a customer. You can modify fields such as the account's description or metadata.
Verify a specific bank account for a customer to ensure its validity. This process typically involves confirming small deposits made to the account.
Retrieve a list of credit cards associated with a customer. The 10 most recent cards are shown by default, but you can paginate through additional cards if needed.

Add a new credit card to a customer's account. If the customer does not have a default card, the new card will become the default. Otherwise, the default will remain unchanged unless updated separately.
Remove a specific credit card from a customer's account. This action deletes the card as a payment source for the customer.
Retrieve details about a specific credit card associated with a customer. This includes information such as the card brand, expiration date, and last four digits.
Update details of a specific credit card for a customer. You can modify fields such as the card's description or metadata.
Retrieve the cash balance of a specific customer. This balance reflects the amount of money available for transactions.
Update the settings of a customer's cash balance. This can include changes to how the balance is managed or used for transactions.

Retrieve a list of transactions that have affected a customer's cash balance. This endpoint provides a detailed history of all changes made to the cash balance, allowing you to track and review financial activities related to a specific customer.

Retrieve details of a specific transaction that has modified a customer's cash balance. This endpoint allows you to access comprehensive information about a particular transaction, including its impact on the customer's balance.
Remove the discount currently applied to a customer. This action will eliminate any ongoing discount benefits the customer is receiving, reverting their charges to standard pricing.

Retrieve information about the discount currently applied to a customer. This endpoint provides details on the discount's terms and conditions, helping you understand the benefits the customer is receiving.

Retrieve or create funding instructions for a customer's cash balance. If instructions already exist, the same ones will be returned. This endpoint ensures that customers have the necessary information to fund their cash balance.
Retrieve a list of payment methods associated with a specific customer. This endpoint provides an overview of all payment options available to the customer, such as credit cards and bank accounts.
Retrieve details of a specific payment method associated with a customer. This endpoint provides comprehensive information about the payment method, such as its type and status.
Retrieve a list of payment sources for a specified customer. This includes all payment methods that the customer has added to their account, such as credit cards and bank accounts.

Add a new credit card to a customer's account. If the customer does not have a default card, the new card will become the default. Otherwise, the existing default card remains unchanged unless updated separately.
Remove a specific payment source from a customer's account. This action deletes the specified source, such as a credit card or bank account, from the customer's list of payment methods.
Retrieve details of a specific payment source for a customer. This endpoint provides information about the payment source, such as its type and status.
Update the details of a specific payment source for a customer. This endpoint allows modifications to the payment source's information, such as expiration date or billing address.
Verify a customer's bank account. This process confirms the bank account's validity and ownership, ensuring it can be used for transactions.
Retrieve a list of active subscriptions for a customer. This endpoint provides details on all ongoing subscriptions, allowing you to manage and review the customer's subscription status.
Create a new subscription for an existing customer. This endpoint allows you to add a subscription plan to a customer's account, enabling recurring billing.

Cancel a customer's subscription. You can choose to end the subscription immediately or at the end of the current billing period. This action stops future billing and can affect pending invoices and prorations.
Retrieve details of a specific subscription using its ID. This endpoint provides comprehensive information about the subscription, including its status and billing cycle.
Update an existing subscription for a customer. This endpoint allows changes to the subscription plan, quantity, or other parameters, with optional proration for price adjustments.
Remove the discount applied to a customer's subscription. This action cancels any discount benefits, reverting the subscription to its standard pricing.
Retrieve information about the discount applied to a customer's subscription. This endpoint provides details on the discount's terms and how it affects the subscription pricing.
Retrieve a list of tax IDs associated with a customer. This endpoint provides an overview of all tax identification numbers linked to the customer's account.
Create a new tax ID for a customer. This endpoint allows you to add tax identification information to a customer's account for billing and compliance purposes.
Delete a specific tax ID from a customer's account. This action removes the tax identification number, affecting how the customer is billed and reported.
Retrieve details of a specific tax ID associated with a customer. This endpoint provides information about the tax ID, such as its type and status.
Retrieve a list of all disputes associated with your account. This endpoint provides an overview of disputes, allowing you to manage and review them effectively.
Retrieve details of a specific dispute using its ID. This endpoint provides comprehensive information about the dispute, including its status and any associated evidence.

Submit evidence for a dispute to help resolve it in your favor. This endpoint allows you to provide documentation and information that supports your case, potentially influencing the outcome of the dispute.
Close a dispute, indicating that you have no further evidence to submit and are accepting the dispute as lost. This action is irreversible and changes the dispute status to 'lost'.
Retrieve a list of active entitlements for a customer. This endpoint provides information about the customer's current entitlements, which may include access to services or features.
Retrieve details of a specific active entitlement for a customer. This endpoint provides information about the entitlement, such as its scope and duration.

Retrieve a comprehensive list of all available features within the entitlements system. This endpoint provides details about each feature, allowing you to understand what functionalities are accessible.
Create a new feature within the entitlements system. This endpoint allows you to define and add a new functionality that can be managed and accessed through the API.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific feature using its unique identifier. This endpoint helps you understand the characteristics and settings of a particular feature.
Update the metadata of a specific feature or deactivate it permanently. This endpoint allows you to modify feature details or disable it if no longer needed.
Create a temporary API key that is short-lived and specific to a given resource. This key is useful for operations that require limited-time access to certain data.
Immediately invalidate a temporary API key, ensuring it can no longer be used to access resources. This is useful for revoking access when it is no longer needed.
Retrieve a list of events that have occurred in your Stripe account over the past 30 days. Each event is presented according to the Stripe API version that was active at the time of its creation.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific event using its unique identifier. This is useful for understanding the context and data of an event that occurred within the last 30 days.
Retrieve a list of exchange rates for converting foreign currencies supported by Stripe. This endpoint provides the conversion rates between different currencies.
Retrieve the exchange rates from a specified currency to all other supported currencies. This helps in understanding how a particular currency converts to others.
Retrieve a list of file links that provide access to files stored in your Stripe account. These links can be used to share files securely.
Create a new file link object that allows secure access to a specific file stored in your Stripe account. This is useful for sharing files with others.
Retrieve the details of a specific file link using its unique identifier. This helps in managing and understanding the access permissions of the file link.
Update an existing file link object to change its properties or permissions. Note that expired links cannot be updated.
Retrieve a list of files accessible to your account, sorted by creation date. This endpoint helps you manage and access files stored in Stripe.
Upload a file to Stripe using a multipart/form-data request. This endpoint allows you to store files securely within your Stripe account.
Retrieve the details of a specific file using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the file and how to access its contents.
Retrieve a list of Financial Connections Account objects. These accounts represent financial data connections established through Stripe.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific Financial Connections Account. This endpoint provides insights into the account's financial data.
Disable access to a Financial Connections Account, preventing further data retrieval. This is useful for terminating access to financial data.
List all owners associated with a specific Financial Connections Account. This helps in identifying individuals linked to the account.
Refresh the data associated with a Financial Connections Account to ensure it is up-to-date. This endpoint is useful for obtaining the latest financial information.
Subscribe to periodic updates of data associated with a Financial Connections Account. This ensures you receive the latest financial data automatically.
Unsubscribe from periodic updates of data associated with a Financial Connections Account. This stops automatic updates of financial data.
Create a session to initiate the Financial Connections authorization flow. The session's client_secret can be used to start the flow using Stripe.js.
Retrieve the details of a Financial Connections Session. This provides information about the session and its current status.
Retrieve a list of Financial Connections Transaction objects. These transactions represent financial activities linked to connected accounts.
Retrieve the details of a specific Financial Connections Transaction. This provides insights into the transaction's data and context.
Retrieve a list of all ForwardingRequest objects. These requests represent actions to forward data or notifications to external systems.
Create a new ForwardingRequest object to initiate the forwarding of data or notifications to an external system.

Retrieve a specific ForwardingRequest object using its unique identifier. This endpoint allows you to access the details of a forwarding request, which is a request to forward data or actions to another service or endpoint.

Retrieve a list of all verification reports. Verification reports contain the results of identity verification checks performed on users. This endpoint provides access to all such reports, allowing you to review verification outcomes.

Retrieve a specific VerificationReport using its unique identifier. A VerificationReport contains the results of an identity verification check for a user, detailing the verification process and its outcome.

Retrieve a list of all VerificationSessions. A VerificationSession represents an instance where a user's identity is being verified. This endpoint provides access to all sessions, allowing you to track and manage identity verification processes.

Create a new VerificationSession object to initiate an identity verification process for a user. After creation, you can display a verification modal or direct users to a URL for verification. Note that in test mode, verification checks are simulated.
Retrieve the details of a specific VerificationSession using its unique identifier. This endpoint allows you to access session details, including the status and any necessary actions for completion.
Update an existing VerificationSession object. This can include modifying verification checks and options, especially when the session status requires additional input.
Cancel a VerificationSession that is in the 'requires_input' status. Once canceled, the session cannot be resumed, and no further submissions are allowed.
Redact a VerificationSession to remove all personal information collected during the session. This process is irreversible and affects all related objects, replacing personal data with placeholders.
Retrieve a list of all invoice rendering templates, sorted by creation date. The most recently created template appears first, allowing you to manage and select templates for invoice presentation.
Retrieve a specific invoice rendering template using its unique ID. By default, the latest version of the template is returned, but you can specify a version to view previous iterations.
Archive an invoice rendering template, preventing it from being used in new Stripe objects. Archived templates remain on existing objects but cannot be updated or referenced anew.
Unarchive an invoice rendering template, allowing it to be used again for new Stripe objects. This action reactivates the template for future use.
Retrieve a list of all invoice items, sorted by creation date. Invoice items are additional charges or credits that can be added to invoices, and this endpoint provides access to all such items.
Create a new invoice item to be added to a draft invoice. If no specific invoice is mentioned, the item will be included in the next invoice for the specified customer.
Delete a specific invoice item, removing it from an invoice. This action is only possible if the item is not attached to a finalized invoice or if it is part of a draft invoice.
Retrieve a specific invoice item using its unique ID. This endpoint provides access to the details of an invoice item, which is an additional charge or credit on an invoice.
Update the amount or description of an existing invoice item on an upcoming invoice. Changes can only be made before the invoice is finalized.
Retrieve a list of all invoices or filter by a specific customer. Invoices are sorted by creation date, with the most recent appearing first, allowing you to manage billing records efficiently.
Create a draft invoice for a specified customer. The invoice remains in draft status until finalized, after which it can be paid or sent to the customer.
Preview the upcoming invoice for a customer, showing pending charges and applicable discounts. This preview helps in understanding future billing without creating an actual invoice.
Search for previously created invoices using Stripe's Search Query Language. This endpoint allows for flexible querying of invoices based on various criteria.
Preview the upcoming invoice for a customer, displaying pending charges and discounts. This endpoint provides a look at future billing without creating an actual invoice.
Retrieve the line items of an upcoming invoice, including a count of total items and a preview of the first few. This helps in understanding the detailed charges before the invoice is finalized.
Permanently delete a draft invoice. This action cannot be undone and is only possible if the invoice is still in draft status.
Retrieve a specific invoice using its unique ID. This endpoint provides access to the details of an invoice, including charges, status, and customer information.
Update a draft invoice. Once finalized, certain fields become uneditable. This endpoint allows modifications to draft invoices before they are finalized.
Add multiple line items to a draft invoice. This action is only possible while the invoice is still in draft status, allowing for bulk updates to invoice content.
paths.summary: Add multiple line items to invoice

paths.description: Manually finalize a draft invoice, making it ready for payment or sending. This action locks certain fields and prepares the invoice for the billing process.
Retrieve the line items of a specific invoice, including a count of total items and a preview of the first few. This helps in understanding the detailed charges on an invoice.

This endpoint allows you to update a specific line item within an invoice. Certain fields, like tax amounts, are unique to the invoice line item and can only be modified here. Other fields, such as the amount, are shared with the invoice item and changes will reflect on both. Note that updates can only be made before the invoice is finalized.
paths.summary: Modify a line item in invoice

paths.description: Use this endpoint to mark an invoice as uncollectible, which is helpful for accounting purposes to track debts that are unlikely to be paid.
This endpoint allows you to manually attempt payment on an invoice outside of the regular billing cycle. This can be useful if you need to collect payment immediately or for other specific reasons.
This endpoint allows you to remove multiple line items from a draft invoice. It is only applicable when the invoice is still in draft status.
paths.summary: Remove multiple line items from invoice

paths.description: This endpoint allows you to manually send an invoice to a customer, bypassing the automatic schedule. Note that if the invoice has already been paid, the email will not reference the payment. In test mode, no emails are sent, but an invoice.sent event is triggered.
This endpoint allows you to update multiple line items on a draft invoice. Changes can only be made while the invoice is still in draft status.
paths.summary: Update multiple line items in invoice

paths.description: This endpoint marks a finalized invoice as void, which cannot be undone. Voiding an invoice is similar to deletion but retains a record for reference. It's important to consult local regulations regarding invoice amendments or cancellations.
Retrieve a list of authorization objects related to card issuing. The list is sorted by creation date, showing the most recent first.
Retrieve details of a specific authorization object related to card issuing.
Update the specified authorization object by setting new values for the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged.
This deprecated endpoint was used to approve a pending authorization within the real-time authorization flow. It is recommended to respond directly to the webhook request for approval instead.
This deprecated endpoint was used to decline a pending authorization within the real-time authorization flow. It is recommended to respond directly to the webhook request for decline instead.
Retrieve a list of cardholder objects related to card issuing. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recent cardholders appearing first.
Create a new cardholder object, which can be used to issue cards. This is essential for managing cardholder details and permissions.
Retrieve details of a specific cardholder object related to card issuing.
Update the specified cardholder object by setting new values for the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged.
Retrieve a list of card objects related to card issuing. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recent cards appearing first.
Create a new card object for issuing. This is used to manage card details and permissions for cardholders.
Retrieve details of a specific card object related to card issuing.
Update the specified card object by setting new values for the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged.
Retrieve a list of dispute objects related to card issuing. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recent disputes appearing first.
Create a new dispute object for card issuing. Evidence is optional at creation but required for submission. Refer to the documentation for evidence requirements.
Retrieve details of a specific dispute object related to card issuing.

Update the specified dispute object by setting new values for the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged. Evidence properties can be unset by passing an empty string.
Submit a dispute to the card network. Stripe ensures all required evidence fields for the dispute's reason are present. Refer to the documentation for more details on evidence requirements.
Retrieve a list of personalization design objects. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recent designs appearing first.
Create a new personalization design object for card issuing. This is used to customize the appearance of issued cards.
Retrieve details of a specific personalization design object related to card issuing.
Update a specific personalization design object by setting new values for the provided parameters. Parameters not included in the request will remain unchanged.
Retrieve a list of physical bundle objects related to card issuing. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recent bundles appearing first.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific physical bundle associated with your Stripe account. A physical bundle typically refers to a collection of physical items or cards issued by Stripe.
paths.summary: Get details of a physical bundle

paths.description: Retrieve information about a specific settlement related to your Stripe-issued cards. A settlement is a financial transaction that finalizes the transfer of funds between parties.
Update the details of a specific settlement by modifying its parameters. This allows you to change certain attributes of the settlement while leaving others unchanged.
Retrieve a list of all token objects associated with a specific card. Tokens are used to represent card details securely without exposing sensitive information.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific token. Tokens are secure representations of card details used in transactions.
Update the status of a specific token. This allows you to change the token's state, such as activating or deactivating it.
Retrieve a list of all transaction objects related to your issued cards. Transactions are sorted by creation date, showing the most recent first.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific transaction associated with your issued cards. Transactions represent financial activities such as purchases or refunds.
Update the details of a specific transaction by modifying its parameters. This allows you to change certain attributes of the transaction while leaving others unchanged.
Create a session to initiate the Financial Connections authorization flow. The session's client_secret is used to start the flow with Stripe.js, allowing users to connect their financial accounts.
Retrieve the details of a specific Financial Connections session. This session contains information necessary for linking financial accounts.
Retrieve a list of all linked financial accounts. These accounts are connected through the Financial Connections feature, allowing access to account data.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific linked financial account. This includes data such as balances and transactions associated with the account.
paths.summary: Get details of a linked account

paths.description: Disconnect a linked financial account, revoking access to its data such as balances and transactions. This action ensures that no further data can be accessed from the account.
Retrieve a list of all owners associated with a specific linked financial account. This provides information about individuals or entities that have ownership of the account.
paths.summary: List owners of a linked account

paths.description: Refresh the data associated with a linked financial account. This updates the account information, ensuring that the latest data is available.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific mandate. A mandate is an authorization for Stripe to debit a customer's account according to agreed terms.
Retrieve a list of all PaymentIntents. A PaymentIntent represents a payment process and tracks the lifecycle of a payment attempt.
Create a new PaymentIntent object to initiate a payment process. After creation, attach a payment method and confirm the intent to proceed with the payment.
Search for previously created PaymentIntents using Stripe's Search Query Language. This feature allows you to find specific PaymentIntents based on various criteria.
Retrieve the details of a specific PaymentIntent. A PaymentIntent tracks the lifecycle of a payment attempt and contains information about the payment process.
Update properties of a specific PaymentIntent without confirming it. Depending on the changes, you might need to confirm the PaymentIntent again.
Manually reconcile the remaining amount for a PaymentIntent using the customer's balance. This action adjusts the PaymentIntent to reflect the balance usage.
Cancel a PaymentIntent that is in a pending state. Once canceled, no further charges will be made, and any pending amounts will be refunded if applicable.
Capture the funds of an existing PaymentIntent that is in the 'requires_capture' status. Capturing finalizes the payment and transfers the funds.
Confirm a PaymentIntent to initiate a payment with the current or provided payment method. This step is necessary to proceed with the payment process.
Perform an incremental authorization on a PaymentIntent to increase the authorized amount. This is useful for adjusting the payment amount before capture.
Verify microdeposits on a PaymentIntent to confirm the bank account details. This step is part of the process to ensure account authenticity.
Retrieve a list of all payment links created in your Stripe account. Payment links are URLs that direct customers to a checkout page for payment.
Create a new payment link to share with customers. Payment links are URLs that lead to a checkout page where customers can complete their purchase.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific payment link. A payment link is a URL that allows customers to make a payment directly. This endpoint provides all the details associated with the payment link, such as its status and configuration.
paths.summary: Get details of a payment link

paths.description: Update the settings or details of an existing payment link. This allows you to modify the configuration of the payment link, such as changing its expiration date or the products it includes.

Retrieve the list of line items associated with a specific payment link. Line items are the individual products or services included in the payment link. This endpoint provides a paginated list of all such items, allowing you to see what is being offered through the link.
paths.summary: Get line items of a payment link

paths.description: Retrieve a list of all payment method configurations available in your Stripe account. Payment method configurations define how different payment methods are set up and used within your account.
Create a new payment method configuration. This allows you to define how a specific payment method should be set up and used in your Stripe account.
Retrieve the details of a specific payment method configuration. This provides information on how a particular payment method is set up within your Stripe account.
Update an existing payment method configuration. This allows you to modify the setup of a payment method within your Stripe account.
Retrieve a list of all existing payment method domains. Payment method domains are used to verify and manage domains for certain payment methods like Apple Pay.
Create a new payment method domain. This is necessary for enabling certain payment methods, such as Apple Pay, on your website.
paths.summary: Create a new payment method domain

paths.description: Retrieve the details of a specific payment method domain. This provides information about the domain's setup and status for payment methods like Apple Pay.
Update the details of an existing payment method domain. This allows you to modify the domain's configuration for payment methods like Apple Pay.
Validate an existing payment method domain to activate payment methods like Apple Pay. This process ensures that the domain meets all necessary requirements for the payment method to be active.
Retrieve a list of PaymentMethods available for Treasury flows. This endpoint is specific to Treasury operations and does not list PaymentMethods attached to a Customer for regular payments.
Create a new PaymentMethod object. This is typically used to set up a payment method for future use. For immediate payments, consider using the PaymentIntents API.
Retrieve details of a specific PaymentMethod object attached to your Stripe account. This is different from retrieving a PaymentMethod attached to a Customer.
Update an existing PaymentMethod object. Note that the PaymentMethod must be attached to a customer to be updated.
Attach a PaymentMethod to a Customer for future payments. It's recommended to use a SetupIntent or PaymentIntent for optimal setup and reduced payment friction.
Detach a PaymentMethod from a Customer. Once detached, the PaymentMethod cannot be used for payments or re-attached to a Customer.
Retrieve a list of all existing payouts. Payouts are sorted with the most recent first and include those sent to third-party bank accounts or to your own account.
Create a new payout to transfer funds to your bank account. Ensure your Stripe balance covers the payout amount to avoid errors.
Retrieve details of a specific payout using its unique ID. This provides information about the payout's status and destination.
Update the metadata of a specific payout. Only metadata can be updated; other payout details remain unchanged.
Cancel a pending payout to refund the funds back to your available balance. Note that automatic payouts cannot be canceled.
Reverse a payout by debiting the destination bank account. This is only available for payouts to US bank accounts and requires authorization from the bank account holder.
paths.summary: Reverse a payout to bank account

paths.description: Retrieve a list of all subscription plans available in your Stripe account. Plans define the recurring billing details for subscriptions.
Create a new subscription plan. Note that the Plans API is being replaced by the Prices API for more flexible subscription modeling.
Delete a subscription plan. This prevents new subscribers from being added, but existing subscribers are not affected.
Retrieve details of a specific subscription plan using its ID. This provides information about the plan's billing cycle, amount, and currency.
Update the details of a specific subscription plan. Note that certain attributes like ID, amount, currency, or billing cycle cannot be changed.
Retrieve a list of all active prices in your Stripe account. Prices define the cost of products or services and can be used in conjunction with the Plans API.

Create a new price for an existing product in your Stripe account. This price can be set as either recurring, such as a subscription, or a one-time charge. This endpoint helps manage pricing strategies for products.

Search for prices you have previously created using Stripe's Search Query Language. This endpoint allows you to find specific prices based on various criteria. Note that search results may not reflect recent changes immediately, and this feature is unavailable to merchants in India.
Retrieve the details of a specific price using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the price, including its amount, currency, and whether it is recurring or one-time.
Update the specified price by modifying the provided parameters. This allows you to change aspects of the price, such as its amount or currency, while leaving unspecified parameters unchanged.

Retrieve a list of all products in your Stripe account. The products are sorted by their creation date, with the most recent ones appearing first. This endpoint helps you manage and view your product catalog.
Create a new product object in your Stripe account. This endpoint allows you to define a product's attributes, such as its name, description, and pricing details.

Search for products you have previously created using Stripe's Search Query Language. This endpoint allows you to locate specific products based on various criteria. Note that search results may not reflect recent changes immediately, and this feature is unavailable to merchants in India.

Delete a product from your Stripe account. A product can only be deleted if it has no associated prices or SKUs, especially for products of type 'good'. This endpoint helps manage your product catalog by removing unwanted items.
Retrieve the details of an existing product using its unique ID. This endpoint provides comprehensive information about the product, including its attributes and pricing details.
Update the specified product by modifying the provided parameters. This allows you to change aspects of the product, such as its name or description, while leaving unspecified parameters unchanged.
Retrieve a list of features associated with a specific product. This endpoint helps you view all the features that are attached to a product, providing insights into its capabilities.
Attach a new feature to a specific product. This endpoint allows you to enhance a product by adding additional capabilities or attributes, known as product features.
Remove a feature attachment from a specific product. This endpoint helps manage the features associated with a product by allowing you to delete unwanted or outdated features.
Retrieve details of a specific feature attached to a product. This endpoint provides information about the feature, helping you understand its role and attributes within the product.
Retrieve a list of all promotion codes in your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you manage and view the promotional discounts available to your customers.
Create a new promotion code that points to a coupon. You can set restrictions such as a specific customer, redemption limit, and expiration date. This endpoint helps you offer discounts to customers.
Retrieve the details of a specific promotion code using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the promotion code, including its restrictions and associated coupon.
Update the specified promotion code by modifying the provided parameters. Note that most fields are not editable by design. This endpoint allows limited updates to existing promotion codes.
Retrieve a list of all quotes in your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you manage and view the quotes you have created for customers, detailing prices and services offered.
Create a new quote that models prices and services for a customer. You can set default options such as header, description, footer, and expiration date via the quote template in the dashboard.
Retrieve the details of a specific quote using its unique ID. This endpoint provides comprehensive information about the quote, including the prices and services offered.
Update the specified quote by modifying the provided parameters. This endpoint allows you to adjust the details of a quote, such as prices and services, for a customer.
Accept a specific quote, indicating that the customer agrees to the prices and services outlined. This endpoint finalizes the agreement between you and the customer.
Cancel a specific quote, indicating that the offer is no longer valid. This endpoint helps manage quotes by allowing you to withdraw offers that are no longer applicable.
Retrieve the upfront line items for a specific quote. This endpoint provides a detailed list of items included in the quote, helping you understand the breakdown of costs and services.
Finalize a specific quote, making it ready for acceptance by the customer. This endpoint confirms the details of the quote and prepares it for the next steps in the sales process.
Retrieve the line items for a specific quote. This endpoint provides a detailed list of items included in the quote, helping you understand the breakdown of costs and services.
Download the PDF version of a finalized quote. This endpoint provides a downloadable document that can be shared with customers, detailing the agreed-upon prices and services.
Retrieve a list of early fraud warnings in your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you monitor and manage potential fraudulent activities by providing alerts for suspicious transactions.
Retrieve the details of a specific early fraud warning using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the warning, helping you assess and respond to potential fraud risks.
Retrieve a list of value list items, which are entries in a value list used for fraud prevention. The items are sorted by creation date, with the newest items appearing first.
Add a new item to a specified value list, which is used for managing entries related to fraud detection.
Remove an item from its parent value list, effectively deleting it from the fraud prevention list.
Fetch the details of a specific value list item, which is part of a list used for fraud detection.
Retrieve a list of value lists, which are collections of items used for fraud prevention. The lists are sorted by creation date, with the newest lists appearing first.
Create a new value list, which can be used to manage entries for fraud detection and prevention.
Delete a value list and all its items, provided it is not currently referenced in any rules. This action removes the list from fraud prevention use.
Retrieve the details of a specific value list, which is used for managing entries related to fraud detection.
Update an existing value list by modifying its parameters. Note that the item type cannot be changed.
Retrieve a list of all refunds that have been created, sorted by the most recent. This includes refunds associated with charges.

Initiate a refund for a previously created charge. You can refund the full amount or a partial amount multiple times until the charge is fully refunded. Once fully refunded, no further refunds can be processed.
Retrieve the details of a specific refund, including its status and amount.
Update the metadata of a specific refund. Only metadata can be modified with this request.
Cancel a refund that is in the 'requires_action' state, applicable only to payment methods needing customer action.
Retrieve a list of report runs, which are instances of reports being generated. The list is sorted by the most recent runs first.
Initiate a new report run, which generates a report based on specified parameters. Some reports may require a live-mode API key.
Retrieve the details of a specific report run, including its status and results.
Retrieve a comprehensive list of available report types, which define the structure and content of reports.
Fetch the details of a specific report type, which outlines the format and data included in the report. Some types may require a live-mode API key.
Retrieve a list of open reviews, which are assessments of potentially fraudulent transactions. The list is sorted by the most recent reviews first.
Retrieve the details of a specific review, which evaluates a transaction for potential fraud.
Approve a review, marking it as resolved and removing it from the list of open reviews.
Retrieve a list of setup attempts associated with a specific setup intent, detailing each attempt to set up a payment method.
Retrieve a list of setup intents, which are used to set up future payments by collecting payment method details.
Create a new setup intent to prepare for future payments. After creation, attach a payment method and confirm it to finalize the setup.
Retrieve the details of a specific setup intent, which includes information about the payment method setup process. Limited details are available when accessed with a publishable key.
Update an existing setup intent by modifying its parameters. This is used to change details about the setup process.
Cancel a setup intent that is in a pending state, such as 'requires_payment_method', 'requires_confirmation', or 'requires_action'. Once canceled, the setup process is halted.
Confirm a setup intent to finalize the setup of a payment method. If no further customer action is needed, the setup will succeed; otherwise, additional steps may be required.
Verify microdeposits for a setup intent, which is a step in confirming the setup of a payment method using microdeposits.

Retrieve a comprehensive list of all shipping rates that have been set up in your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you manage and review the different shipping options available for your transactions.
Create a new shipping rate object to define the cost and details of shipping for your products. This allows you to specify how much customers will be charged for shipping during checkout.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific shipping rate using its unique identifier. This endpoint allows you to access all the attributes and settings of a particular shipping rate.
paths.summary: Get details of a shipping rate

paths.description: Update an existing shipping rate object with new information. This endpoint allows you to modify the details of a shipping rate, such as its cost or description, to better fit your business needs.
Retrieve a list of all scheduled query runs that have been executed. This endpoint provides insights into the data queries that have been scheduled and their execution status.
Get detailed information about a specific scheduled query run using its unique identifier. This endpoint allows you to see the results and status of a particular query execution.
paths.summary: Get details of a query run

paths.description: Create a new source object, which represents a payment method in the Stripe API. Sources can be used to initiate payments and are flexible enough to support a variety of payment methods.
Retrieve an existing source object by providing its unique ID. This endpoint returns the current state and details of the source, which is a representation of a payment method.
Update the specified source object by setting new values for its parameters. This endpoint allows you to modify metadata, owner information, and type-specific details for the source.
Retrieve a specific Source MandateNotification, which provides information about mandates associated with a source. Mandates are agreements between you and your customer for future payments.
List all transactions associated with a specific source. This endpoint provides a detailed view of the financial activities linked to a particular payment method.
Retrieve details of a specific source transaction using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about a particular transaction linked to a payment source.
paths.summary: Get details of a source transaction

paths.description: Verify a specific source to ensure its validity and readiness for transactions. This process is crucial for confirming the authenticity of a payment method before use.
Retrieve a list of all subscription items associated with a specific subscription. This endpoint helps you manage and review the items included in a customer's subscription plan.
Add a new item to an existing subscription without altering the current items. This endpoint allows you to expand a customer's subscription with additional services or products.
Remove an item from a subscription without canceling the entire subscription. This endpoint allows you to adjust a customer's subscription by deleting specific items.
Retrieve details of a specific subscription item using its unique ID. This endpoint provides information about the item, such as its plan and quantity, within a subscription.
Update the plan or quantity of a specific item within a subscription. This endpoint allows you to modify the terms of a customer's subscription to better suit their needs.
Retrieve a list of usage record summaries for a specific subscription item. Each summary provides aggregated usage data over a billing period, helping you track customer usage patterns.

Create a usage record for a specific subscription item, detailing the quantity used on a given date. This information is crucial for metered billing, allowing accurate invoicing based on customer usage.
Retrieve a list of all subscription schedules in your account. Subscription schedules allow you to plan and manage complex billing arrangements over time.
Create a new subscription schedule, which allows you to define a series of subscription phases for a customer. This is useful for setting up billing plans that change over time.
Retrieve details of a specific subscription schedule using its unique identifier. This endpoint provides information about the schedule's phases and current status.
Update an existing subscription schedule with new details. This endpoint allows you to modify the phases or other attributes of a schedule to better fit your billing needs.
Cancel a subscription schedule and its associated subscription immediately if active. This endpoint is used to stop future billing phases and terminate the schedule.
Release a subscription schedule, stopping its phases but keeping any existing subscription active. This endpoint is useful for ending a schedule while maintaining the current subscription.
Retrieve a list of active subscriptions by default. To include canceled subscriptions, specify the status parameter. This endpoint helps you manage and review customer subscriptions.
Create a new subscription for an existing customer. This endpoint allows you to set up recurring billing for services or products, with options for automatic or manual payment collection.

Search for previously created subscriptions using Stripe's Search Query Language. This endpoint allows you to find subscriptions based on specific criteria, but note that search results may not be immediately consistent.
Cancel a customer's subscription immediately, stopping future charges. This endpoint ensures that no further billing occurs, although pending charges may still be processed.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific subscription using its unique ID. This endpoint allows you to access the current status, billing details, and other relevant information about the subscription.

Update an existing subscription to reflect new parameters such as pricing or quantity. This endpoint supports prorating changes, meaning adjustments to billing can be made to account for mid-cycle changes. You can control proration behavior to either apply immediate charges or defer them to the next billing cycle.
Remove any discount currently applied to a subscription. This action will stop the discount from affecting future billing cycles, reverting the subscription to its original pricing.

Resume a previously paused subscription, potentially resetting the billing cycle and creating prorations. The subscription will become active if payment is successful, or past due if payment fails. Any generated resumption invoice must be settled before the subscription is fully resumed.
Calculate tax based on provided input details and return a Tax Calculation object. This object includes the computed tax amount and other relevant tax information.
Retrieve a specific Tax Calculation object using its unique ID, provided the calculation has not expired. This allows you to view the details of a previously computed tax calculation.
Retrieve the line items associated with a specific tax calculation as a collection, provided the calculation has not expired. This includes detailed breakdowns of the tax components.
Retrieve a list of all Tax Registration objects associated with your account. These objects contain information about your tax registration status in various jurisdictions.
Create a new Tax Registration object, which represents your registration for tax purposes in a specific jurisdiction. This is necessary for compliance with local tax laws.
Retrieve details of a specific Tax Registration object using its unique ID. This includes information about your tax registration in a particular jurisdiction.
Update an existing Tax Registration object with new information. Note that registrations cannot be deleted, but you can set an expiration date to end a registration.
Retrieve the current Tax Settings for your account. These settings influence how taxes are calculated and applied to your transactions.
Update the Tax Settings for your account, which are used in tax calculations. While all parameters can be edited, none can be removed once set.
Create a Tax Transaction from an existing calculation, provided the calculation has not expired. Calculations expire after 90 days.
Reverse a previously created Tax Transaction, either partially or fully. This is useful for correcting errors or handling returns.
Retrieve details of a specific Tax Transaction object using its unique ID. This includes information about the transaction's tax components and status.
Retrieve the line items of a specific tax transaction as a collection. This provides a detailed breakdown of the transaction's tax components.
Retrieve a list of all available tax codes that can be applied to products for specific tax calculations. Tax codes help categorize products for tax purposes.
Retrieve details of a specific tax code using its unique ID. This includes information about the tax code's applicability and usage.
Retrieve a list of all tax IDs associated with your account or customers. Tax IDs are used for tax reporting and compliance.
Create a new tax ID for an account or customer. Tax IDs are necessary for tax reporting and compliance in various jurisdictions.
Delete an existing tax ID associated with an account or customer. This action is irreversible and removes the tax ID from your records.
Retrieve details of a specific tax ID associated with an account or customer using its unique ID. This includes information about the tax ID's status and jurisdiction.
Retrieve a list of all tax rates associated with your account. Tax rates are sorted by creation date, with the most recent appearing first.
Create a new tax rate for your account. Tax rates are used to calculate the amount of tax to apply to transactions.
Retrieve details of a specific tax rate using its unique ID. This includes information about the rate's percentage and applicability.
Update an existing tax rate with new information. This can include changes to the rate's percentage or applicability.
Retrieve a list of all Configuration objects for your terminal devices. These configurations determine how your terminal devices operate.
Create a new Configuration object for your terminal devices. This configuration will dictate the settings and behavior of your terminals.
Delete a specific Configuration object for your terminal devices. This action removes the configuration and its settings from your account.
Fetches a specific Configuration object for Stripe Terminal. This object contains settings and preferences for terminal devices, allowing you to manage how they operate.
Modifies an existing Configuration object for Stripe Terminal. This allows you to update settings and preferences for terminal devices, ensuring they meet your operational needs.

Generates a short-lived connection token required by the Stripe Terminal SDK to connect to a reader. This token is created on your server and is essential for establishing a secure connection between your application and the terminal device.

Retrieves a list of all Location objects associated with your Stripe account. Locations represent physical places where your terminal devices are used, and this endpoint helps you manage and view them.
Creates a new Location object for your Stripe account. This is used to define a physical place where your terminal devices will operate. Refer to the guide for address requirements per country.
Removes a specific Location object from your Stripe account. This action is irreversible and will delete the location where terminal devices are registered.
Fetches details of a specific Location object. This allows you to view information about a particular physical place where your terminal devices are used.
Updates an existing Location object by modifying its attributes. This allows you to change details about a physical place where your terminal devices operate without altering unspecified parameters.
Retrieves a list of all Reader objects associated with your Stripe account. Readers are devices used to accept payments, and this endpoint helps you manage and view them.
Creates a new Reader object for your Stripe account. Readers are devices that facilitate payment processing, and this endpoint allows you to register new devices.
Deletes a specific Reader object from your Stripe account. This action is irreversible and will remove the device used for payment processing.
Fetches details of a specific Reader object. This allows you to view information about a particular device used for accepting payments.
Updates an existing Reader object by modifying its attributes. This allows you to change details about a payment processing device without altering unspecified parameters.
Cancels the current action being performed by a Reader device. This is useful for stopping any ongoing process, such as a payment or setup flow, on the terminal.
Initiates a payment process on a Reader device using a PaymentIntent. This allows the terminal to handle the payment flow, including customer interaction and transaction completion.
Initiates a setup process on a Reader device using a SetupIntent. This allows the terminal to handle the setup flow, such as saving payment details for future use.

Initiates a refund process on a Reader device for a previous charge or PaymentIntent. This allows you to handle refunds directly through the terminal, providing a seamless in-person transaction experience.
Configures the display of a Reader device to show cart details. This is useful for providing customers with a visual summary of their purchase directly on the terminal screen.
Generates a Confirmation Token in test mode for integration testing purposes. This token simulates real-world scenarios, allowing you to test your application's handling of confirmation processes.
