Simulates an incoming bank transfer in test mode to fund a customer's cash balance. This is useful for testing scenarios where customers add funds to their account balance.
Creates an authorization in test mode for testing purposes. This allows you to simulate the authorization process for card transactions without affecting real accounts.
Captures a previously created test-mode authorization. This simulates the process of finalizing a transaction, allowing you to test the capture functionality.
Expires a test-mode authorization, simulating the scenario where an authorization is no longer valid. This is useful for testing how your application handles expired authorizations.
Finalizes the amount on a test-mode authorization before capture. This is used when the initial authorization was for an estimated amount, allowing you to test the adjustment of transaction amounts.
Increments the amount of a test-mode authorization. This simulates increasing the authorized amount for a transaction, useful for testing scenarios where additional funds are required.
Reverses a test-mode authorization, simulating the process of undoing an authorization. This is useful for testing how your application handles authorization reversals.
Updates the shipping status of a test-mode Issuing Card object to delivered. This simulates the delivery of a card, allowing you to test the card delivery process.
Updates the shipping status of a test-mode Issuing Card object to failure. This simulates a failed delivery attempt, allowing you to test how your application handles delivery failures.
Updates the shipping status of a test-mode Issuing Card object to returned. This simulates the return of a card, allowing you to test how your application handles returned shipments.
Updates the shipping status of a test-mode Issuing Card object to shipped. This simulates the shipping of a card, allowing you to test the card shipment process.

This endpoint updates the shipping status of a specified Issuing Card object to 'submitted'. It is used in test mode to simulate the submission of a card's shipping status. This operation requires Stripe Version '2024-09-30.acacia' or later.
This endpoint changes the status of a specified test mode personalization design to 'active'. It is used to simulate the activation of a card design in test environments.
This endpoint updates the status of a specified test mode personalization design to 'inactive'. It is used to simulate the deactivation of a card design in test environments.
This endpoint changes the status of a specified test mode personalization design to 'rejected'. It is used to simulate the rejection of a card design in test environments.
This endpoint allows you to create a settlement in test mode for Issuing transactions. It is used to simulate the settlement process in a controlled environment.
This endpoint allows you to perform a forced capture of an arbitrary amount in test mode. It is used to simulate capturing funds without a prior authorization.
This endpoint allows you to issue a refund for an arbitrary amount in test mode, known as an unlinked refund. It is used to simulate refunding a transaction without linking it to a specific charge.
This endpoint allows you to refund a specific transaction in test mode. It is used to simulate the refund process for a transaction that has been previously captured.
This endpoint allows you to expire a refund that is in the 'requires_action' status in test mode. It is used to simulate the expiration of a pending refund.

This endpoint simulates presenting a payment method on a virtual reader. It can be used to test scenarios such as accepting a payment, saving a card, or refunding a transaction in a simulated environment.
This endpoint retrieves a list of all your test clocks. Test clocks are used to simulate time-based events in a controlled test environment.
This endpoint creates a new test clock, which can be attached to new customers and quotes. Test clocks allow you to simulate time progression for testing purposes.
This endpoint deletes a specified test clock. Deleting a test clock removes it from your test environment.
This endpoint retrieves the details of a specified test clock. Test clocks are used to simulate time-based events in a test environment.
This endpoint advances a test clock to a specified future time. The advancement is complete when the status changes to 'Ready'. It is used to simulate future events in a test environment.
This endpoint transitions a test mode InboundTransfer to the 'failed' status. The InboundTransfer must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as failed.
This endpoint marks a test mode InboundTransfer as returned and links it to a ReceivedDebit. The InboundTransfer must be in the 'succeeded' state before it can be returned.
This endpoint transitions a test mode InboundTransfer to the 'succeeded' status. The InboundTransfer must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as succeeded.
This endpoint updates a test mode OutboundPayment with tracking details. The OutboundPayment must not be cancelable and cannot be in the 'canceled' or 'failed' states.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundPayment to the 'failed' status. The OutboundPayment must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as failed.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundPayment to the 'posted' status. The OutboundPayment must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as posted.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundPayment to the 'returned' status. The OutboundPayment must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as returned.
This endpoint updates a test mode OutboundTransfer with tracking details. The OutboundTransfer must not be cancelable and cannot be in the 'canceled' or 'failed' states.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundTransfer to the 'failed' status. The OutboundTransfer must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as failed.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundTransfer to the 'posted' status. The OutboundTransfer must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as posted.
This endpoint transitions a test mode OutboundTransfer to the 'returned' status. The OutboundTransfer must be in the 'processing' state before it can be marked as returned.
This endpoint simulates a test mode ReceivedCredit initiated by a third party. In live mode, you cannot directly create ReceivedCredits initiated by third parties.
This endpoint simulates a test mode ReceivedDebit initiated by a third party. In live mode, you cannot directly create ReceivedDebits initiated by third parties.

This endpoint creates a single-use token representing a bank account's details. This token can be used with any v1 API method in place of a bank account dictionary and is valid for one-time use only. It is typically attached to a connected account where the controller's requirement collection is set to 'application', including Custom accounts.
This endpoint retrieves the details of a token using its unique ID. Tokens are used to securely represent sensitive information like bank account details.
Retrieve a comprehensive list of all top-up transactions associated with your account. Top-ups are used to add funds to your Stripe balance, which can then be used for various transactions.
Initiate a new top-up to add funds to your Stripe account balance. This process increases the available balance for future transactions.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific top-up using its unique ID. This includes the status, amount, and other relevant details of the top-up.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific top-up

paths.description: Modify the metadata of an existing top-up. Note that only metadata can be updated; other details of the top-up remain unchanged.
Cancel a pending top-up transaction. Only top-ups that have not yet been completed can be canceled.
Retrieve a list of all transfers made to connected accounts. Transfers are sorted by creation date, with the most recent appearing first.
Create a new transfer to send funds from your Stripe account to a connected account. Ensure your Stripe balance can cover the transfer amount to avoid errors.
paths.summary: Send funds to a connected account

paths.description: Access a list of reversals for a specific transfer. Use this to view more than the default 10 most recent reversals associated with a transfer.
Create a reversal for a specific transfer. You can reverse part or all of the transfer amount, but once fully reversed, no further reversals can be made.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific transfer using its unique ID. This includes the transfer's status, amount, and other relevant details.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific transfer

paths.description: Update the metadata of a specific transfer. Only metadata can be modified; other transfer details remain unchanged.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific reversal associated with a transfer. This includes the reversal's status and amount.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific reversal

paths.description: Update the metadata and description of a specific reversal. Only these fields can be modified; other reversal details remain unchanged.
Retrieve a list of all CreditReversal objects. CreditReversals are used to reverse received credits in your account.
Create a new CreditReversal to reverse a previously received credit. This action generates a CreditReversal object.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific CreditReversal using its unique ID. This includes the reversal's status and associated credit details.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific CreditReversal

paths.description: Retrieve a list of all DebitReversal objects. DebitReversals are used to reverse received debits in your account.
Create a new DebitReversal to reverse a previously received debit. This action generates a DebitReversal object.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific DebitReversal using its unique ID. This includes the reversal's status and associated debit details.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific DebitReversal

paths.description: Retrieve a list of all FinancialAccount objects. FinancialAccounts represent accounts that hold funds and facilitate transactions.
Create a new FinancialAccount for a connected account. Currently, each connected account can have only one FinancialAccount.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific FinancialAccount using its unique ID. This includes account status, balance, and other relevant details.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific FinancialAccount

paths.description: Update the details of a specific FinancialAccount. Only certain fields, such as metadata, can be modified.
Retrieve information about the features associated with a specific FinancialAccount. This includes capabilities and settings available for the account.
Update the features associated with a specific FinancialAccount. This may include enabling or disabling certain capabilities.
Retrieve a list of all InboundTransfers sent from a specified FinancialAccount. InboundTransfers represent funds moving into your account.
Create a new InboundTransfer to move funds into your FinancialAccount. This process facilitates the receipt of funds from external sources.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific InboundTransfer using its unique ID. This includes the transfer's status, amount, and other relevant details.
paths.summary: Get details of a specific InboundTransfer

paths.description: Cancel a specific InboundTransfer. This action can only be performed on transfers that have not yet been completed.
Retrieve a list of all OutboundPayments sent from a specified FinancialAccount. OutboundPayments represent funds moving out of your account.

This endpoint allows you to create a new OutboundPayment, which is a transaction where funds are sent from your Stripe account to an external bank account or debit card. It is used to facilitate payments to vendors, suppliers, or other external parties.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific OutboundPayment using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the status, amount, and destination of the payment, helping you track and manage outgoing transactions.
Cancel a pending OutboundPayment before it is processed. This endpoint is useful if you need to stop a payment that has not yet been completed, ensuring funds are not sent out.

Retrieve a list of all OutboundTransfers from a specified FinancialAccount. This endpoint helps you monitor and review all outgoing transfers, providing details such as amounts, destinations, and statuses.
Create a new OutboundTransfer to move funds from your Stripe account to an external bank account or debit card. This is typically used for transferring funds to vendors or other external entities.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific OutboundTransfer using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the transfer's status, amount, and destination, helping you track and manage outgoing transfers.
Cancel an OutboundTransfer if the funds have not yet been paid out. This endpoint is useful for stopping a transfer that is still pending, ensuring that funds remain in your account.
Retrieve a list of all ReceivedCredits, which are incoming transactions to your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you track and review credits received from external sources.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific ReceivedCredit using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the credit's source, amount, and status, helping you manage incoming funds.
Retrieve a list of all ReceivedDebits, which are outgoing transactions from your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you track and review debits made to external entities.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific ReceivedDebit using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the debit's destination, amount, and status, helping you manage outgoing funds.

Retrieve a list of TransactionEntry objects, which represent individual entries in your financial account's ledger. This endpoint helps you review and analyze all transactions recorded in your account.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific TransactionEntry using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the transaction's details, such as amount, date, and type, helping you manage your financial records.
Retrieve a list of Transaction objects, representing all financial transactions associated with your Stripe account. This endpoint helps you monitor and analyze your account's financial activity.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific Transaction using its unique ID. This endpoint provides insights into the transaction's details, such as amount, date, and type, helping you manage your financial records.
Retrieve a list of all your webhook endpoints. Webhook endpoints are URLs configured to receive event notifications from Stripe, allowing you to automate responses to specific events.

Create a new webhook endpoint by specifying a URL and a list of events you want to receive notifications for. Optionally, you can create a Connect webhook endpoint to receive events from all connected accounts.
paths.summary: Set up a new webhook endpoint

paths.description: Delete a specific webhook endpoint using its unique ID. This action stops the endpoint from receiving any further event notifications from Stripe.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific webhook endpoint using its unique ID. This endpoint provides details such as the URL, enabled events, and status of the webhook.
paths.summary: Get details of a webhook endpoint

paths.description: Update an existing webhook endpoint by modifying its URL, the list of events it listens to, or its status. This allows you to adjust the endpoint's configuration as needed.
